abstract.text: Display a 3D model that generates procedural textures in a reality view.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This sample demonstrates how to create and display a 3D torus model that dynamically regenerates a
texture at each render frame within a visionOS app.
At launch, the app starts a window group that contains:
A 3D torus model with a generated texture
A button displaying the text “generate”

abstract.text: A basic random number generator implementing the ARC4 algorithm, which is suitable for most gameplay mechanics.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
Synchronously loads a model entity from a bundle.
A material that simulates the appearance of real-world objects.
A drawable queue that may be used to update a texture resource dynamically
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value managed by SwiftUI.
An abstraction for data-reading tasks that eliminates the need to manage a raw memory buffer.
A bitmap image or image mask.
Create a new universe of apps and games for Apple Vision Pro.
Build a stereoscopic image by applying textures to the left and right eye in a shader graph material.
Update the adjustable parameters of a 3D model in visionOS.
Learn the fundamentals of building apps for visionOS with beginner-friendly sample code projects.

introductory-visionOS-samples.png.alt: A translucent window displaying five white, three-dimensional entities in a horizontal row. From left to right, the shapes are a box, a rounded box, a right sphere, a cone, and a cylinder that all top-align.

sample-drawable-1-main-view.mp4.alt: A video of a visionOS app displaying a translucent window with a 3D torus model on the left and a button on the right.

visionOS-PageImage-card.png.alt: A stylized illustration of an Apple Vision Pro with the word 'hello' written across the front in cursive.
